extendedInfo.description: Pregnancy is the carrying of one or more offspring, known as a fetus or embryo, in the womb of a woman. In a pregnancy, there can be multiple gestations, as in the case of twins or triplets. Childbirth usually occurs about 38 weeks after conception; in women who have a menstrual cycle length of four weeks, this is approximately 40 weeks from the last normal menstrual period (LNMP). The World Health Organization defines normal term for delivery as between 37 weeks and 42 weeks. Human pregnancy is the most studied of all mammalian pregnancies.One scientific term for the state of pregnancy is gravidity (adjective "gravid"), latin for âheavyâ and a pregnant female is sometimes referred to as a gravida.[1] Similarly, the term parity (abbreviated as âparaâ) is used for the number of previous successful live births. Medically, a woman who has never been pregnant is referred to as a ânulligravidaâ, a woman who is (or has been only) pregnant for the first time as a âprimigravidaâ, and a woman in subsequent pregnancies as a multigravida or âmultiparous.â Hence, during a second pregnancy a woman would be described as âgravida 2, para 1â and upon live delivery as âgravida 2, para 2.â An in-progress pregnancy, as well as abortions, miscarriages, or stillbirths account for parity values being less than the gravida number. In the case of twins, triplets etc., gravida number and parity value are increased by one only. Women who have never carried a pregnancy achieving more than 20 weeks of gestation age are referred to as ânulliparous.âThe term embryo is used to describe the developing offspring during the first 8 weeks following conception, and the term fetus is used from about 2 months of development until birth.In many societiesâ medical or legal definitions, human pregnancy is somewhat arbitrarily divided into three trimester periods, as a means to simplify reference to the different stages of prenatal development. The first trimester carries the highest risk of miscarriage (natural death of embryo or fetus). During the second trimester, the development of the fetus can be more easily monitored and diagnosed. The beginning of the third trimester often approximates the point of viability, or the ability of the fetus to survive, with or without medical help, outside of the uterus.This free app is ad supported and may contain ads in the notification tray and/or home screen.To avoid ads go for pro version

reviews.title: Eh...
reviews.comment: Good content and pictures, but i had the app downloaded on my phone and had 4 popups! Uninstalled immediately!
reviews.author: Crystal Williams

reviews.title: Ok
reviews.comment: Gotta proofread; no ones perfect, but for people to understand better they gotta know what their reading correctly. Good information tho. Some people really depend on apps like this, like I myself.
reviews.author: Sticks Jones

reviews.title: No good!
reviews.comment: I thought this app would be helpful. Turns out its just a waste of time. It created several unwanted addons and automatically went on the internet for some scam crap. DONT WASTE YOUR TIME
reviews.author: Andrea Hagerty

reviews.title: Good app but an ad scam
reviews.comment: The app contains informational and brilliant contents but too bad the it was attached with ad scam which will install various junks and stupid ads. I have to uninstall it immediately. The content was 5 stars but the app is just absurd.
reviews.author: Ahmad Firdaus

reviews.title: would be very helpful but too much spam
reviews.comment: I down loaded the app and it had lots of good information. But not worth all of the spam. I got 3 pop ups, and it installed 3 different apps on my home screen all within a minute. Deleted immediately!!
reviews.author: Heidi Shepherd

reviews.title: Worthless and such a pain
reviews.comment: Not only is the app itself completely useless, it installs a ton of junk on your phone. Don\'t waste your time!
reviews.author: Leah Russell

reviews.title: Hate it
reviews.comment: It creates ads and extra short cuts on your phone
reviews.author: Jessica Gibbs

reviews.title: Great work
reviews.comment: Very useful for pregnancy womens & their spouse.
reviews.author: A Google User
